data.title: Sacrum Profanum
data.text:
Graduate of the Academy of Music in Krakow (2013). He is mainly engaged in performing chamber music. Cellist in the Sine Nomine Ensemble, with which he has performed in Poland and Sweden. As a member of a string quartet, he finished fourth (2006) and first (2007) in the Talents for Europe Festival in Dolny Kubin in Slovakia; the ensemble also won a special prize sponsored by Moyzes Quartet (2007).

In 2010, along with the Contré string quartet, he received a scholarship to participate in master courses as part of the Oberstdorfer Musiksommer festival, where he worked under the direction of Peter Buck (Melos Quartet) and was honoured with participation in one of the finale concerts. As a chamber musician, he has performed with the Krakow Philharmonic, the Kielce Philharmonic, the Jahannisheim Hall in Oberstdorf (Germany), the Château d’Eu (France), the Evangeliska Kyrkan in Landskrona (Sweden), the Karol Szymanowski Museum at the Villa Atma in Zakopane and at the All Sides of the World Festival in Puławy. He has collaborated with such artists as Raminta Lampsatis, Marek Chołoniewski, Marek Nosal, Adam Klocek, Aleksander Dębicz and Grzegorz Palus. Since 2008, he has been the first cellist and soloist of Archetti – the Chamber Orchestra of the City of Jaworzno, with which he has performed in Poland, Germany, Austria, Belgium and Sweden. As an orchestral musician, he has collaborated with the Krakow Philharmonic Orchestra, the Temporanea Orchestra and the Kalisz Philharmonic Orchestra, with which he has toured Germany twice. He has actively participated in numerous master courses, conducted by such names as Kazimierz Michalik, Tomasz Strahl, Peter Buck, Roman Jabłoński, Adam Klocek, Ulf Tischbirk, Jerome Vidaliér and Jean-Pierre Menuge. His interest in contemporary music has resulted in collaboration with Lithuanian pianist Raminta Lampsatis and many composers, including Mateusz Bień, Krzysztof Kostrzewa, Emil Bernard Wojtack, Michał Jakub Papara and Michał Gronowicz, of whose works he has frequently given premiere performances. He is no stranger to pop music: together with violinist Jakub Bańdur, he forms PerDuo Nvc, performing improvised music inspired by blues and jazz. The duo received the special award of the Blue Spod Festival 2014, was a finalist at the Rybnik Blues Festival 2014 and KiepuraFest 2014, as well as inaugurating the 44th FAMA in Świnoujście. As a session and stage musician, he collaborates, among others, with bands Seven Seeds, Alergen and Sztywny Pal Azji, with whom he has recorded albums Fiss Pink and Odnalezione piosenki Bogdana Łyszkiewicza.
